transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: (somewhat agitated) Alright, let's do it, fine.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's right you'll do it. 'Cause I said it. Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (over Tenacious D's song) Wait. What is this? Heh, this ain't cuttin' it.

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: What's the name of the song?

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: Don't know what it's about, but it's good to goWhat's the name of my-

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (over Jack's singing) No, no, no, no, no, stop!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Explosivo? What's that mean? You're fat?!

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: It becomes an evil word, if you say it low. (in a low voice) Explosivo.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Naw, man, that ain't gonna make any money.

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: We should get a big evil puppet behind us, in, uh, concert man?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Shyeah, man, and he's totally allergic to pollen.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (obviously making it up as he goes along) And he's got these big... like... oven mitts, or somethin', man.

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: (looks at Moltar in disappointment and shakes head) That's not evil.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (still making it up as he goes along) Yeah it is! 'Cause he's bakin' in, in the kitchen of darkness. A pie of, of lost souls, until it's, it's golden brown.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. But, but, but you can't eat it, even though you want to, you gotta let it cool off on the window.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The, the windowsill to... TO HELL!

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: Are you goin' off the script?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Look, you guys need to spew more blood. For Satan. He likes that.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But you don't want to puke out your own blood, you understand, 'cause your gonna need those nutrients to perform the encore.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So you're gonna need the blood of another. Somebody else. Now check this out. Hand me the goat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry I'm late, have I missed anything?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (holding the goat, which baas constantly) Uh, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well what are you doing with that goat?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Heh, I don't know? Milkin' it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How many times have I told you not to hang that giant beast head from the light grid? Take it home. Put it in your own house. It smells horrible.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Look, Satan is supposed to come pick it up.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Shyeah, man, we're doin' it for Satan.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Satan. Did I meet him? At, at the open house?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, he was the guy, that was tryin' to get you to- kill that girl.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, you know, with the necktie. And, uh, crown made of femurs.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Maybe you didn't see him. Your eyes were all rolled back in your head.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, man, and you kept sayin' "Satan, daddy, satan!"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Space Ghost, come in here, let me show you.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Whoa! Oh, okay, see, there he is, that's Damien.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still holding the goat, which is still baahing) I'll show ya! I'll show all o' ya!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look Zorak, I just watched all four "Omen" movies, including the crappy third one where he was president. (pounds fist)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That old wive's tale? Kyle, asses don't exist. Everyone knows that.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, where'd ya learn that? Batman Fantasy Camp?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey Zorak, get out the diary! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: "Today we looked after Alfred's older sister and made sure she didn't swallow her own tongue."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: "Haven't gotten to meet Batman yet. So far everyone seems old and in need of care."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You stole that out of my Bat-locker! (pounds fist on desk)

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: Is that why you look like Batman?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Batman does, but Space Ghost doesn't, and there's the key difference.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because I was bitten by a radioactive spider, Zorak! The kind that didn't care for ears.

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: You see, he looks for the sensitive spot, and then he- (motions with his hand like somebody poking at something with a fork)

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: Why would that be a sensitive spot?

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: Uh, it just seemed like a sensitive spot, there was a shifting and a...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But that is how I got my superpowers

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you talkin' about Brak? Don't. He's dead to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So's his sitcom, which apparently is extremely popular.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: More like runoff. From a waste pump.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I'm hopin' it'll even my own show. My show's not a comedy, it's a horredy. It's called Blood Dumpster.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Your pilot gave me nightmares! This is 22 minutes of a guy running down a tunnel.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And what's with your character, the guy with the blades? What's that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who's gonna identify with the "dumpsterkeeper"? I mean, maybe if he were in a motorized wheelchair you'd have some sense of sympathy for him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Brak is nothing without me. If it weren't for me he'd still be doing his show which he's doing now without me.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: Can we meet him, is he here?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why do you want to meet him? He's probably drunk.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh sure, everyone thinks he's cute on the outside. But on the inside, heh, his organs are buoys, bouncing around on a sea of gin.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whadda ya think of that, children?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, my feelings are so much deeper and more complex than Brak. I mean, I love more than beans, let's just say that. I love... bicycles. And there's, there's way more that goes into that.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: Well, is, is your bicycle special? I don't understand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well yeah, it's special. My dad threw it at me every chance he got.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's why I started sleepin' in the trees. He couldn't throw it that high.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: I just, I just had to get some coffee.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Sing a song about my bicycle! But... none of that stuff about my dad, and sleeping in trees, and having to eat walnuts and bark for nourishment... and of course being called Tree Wizard in school.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: (annoyed) Yes, I've got some chords. (starts playing his guitar)

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: (singing) Space Ghost and his bicycle.   Much better than just a tricycle.   Why doesn't he have rocketcycle?   Heyyyyyyy! Argggh!!!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Rocketcycle? Well I'll tell you why I don't have a rocketcycle. They don't exist. Now keep going.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, that's NOT it. Sing something about how my thighs, and, uh, how they've developed from riding the bicycle.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) Alright, verse two. (starts playing again)

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: (singing) He rides it all around. Inside his ship. He doesn't go outside his freakin' ship, oh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (singing) Doin' lots of flips. Then I start to strip.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (no longer singing) Hold on. Wait a minute!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Your song made me sing horrible things! Do another song and do it right.

transcript.speaker: Kyle Gass
transcript.dialogue: Which one would you like to hear?

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's kind of a short one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You give me the long one!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, get the candles. Set the mood.

transcript.speaker: Jack Black
transcript.dialogue: This isn't gonna be allowed on.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, it's not, man. Some lawyer just called from the label. We can't clear the song.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?! No lawyer's gonna tell Space Ghost what to do. Kyle, Jack? You do your most famous song and make SURE it's from your latest album.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (singing over the song) Time in a bottle!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes it was pretty. I've never heard it live. That totally rocked.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, uh, Space Ghost? Some guy up here wants to see ya.

transcript.speaker: Satan
transcript.dialogue: (looking angry) Now you listen to me. I'm here to get you on a sitcom. You want to get on a sitcom, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can you get me on the Brak Show?

transcript.speaker: Satan
transcript.dialogue: (now smiling) They have already cast that one. But I've got some connections with this other show. It'll cost you. Dearly.
